CatDescriptText: W.H. Mercer, 1615 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 25, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think there would be less juvenile delinquency if the father were restored to his original role as sole head of the house?" answer reads: "Yes, in first place he is the boss. And also it's his duty to see that the family will be well protected and the kids raised so that they will not devote themselves to juvenile delinquency."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of W.H. Mercer wearing trench coat, cap, and eyeglasses, standing next to reporter holding steno pad and newspaper, buildings in background
